name: Islamic Society of Northwest Suburbs of Chicago
mission: Teaching and reading of the holy Quran, daily and Friday congregations, Islamic Education for Children and perform marriages and funeral services
zakatClaimEvidence: The Islamic Society of Northwest Suburbs (ISNS) explicitly states, "Donate your ZAKAT to ISNS" and provides methods for donation including mailing a check, dropping it off in a Zakah drop box, and an online Zakat Request form. They also have a 'Zakah Committee'. all_citations.claim: The organization focuses on Quranic teaching, daily congregations, and Islamic education for children.
The organization reported total revenue of $4,092,615, a 92.5% program expense ratio, and 117.3 months of working capital.
The organization offers various donation options and is recognized as zakat-eligible.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and strong alignment with donor needs, though it is limited by low data transparency and a lack of independent impact verification.
areas_for_improvement: Limited third-party impact data and external evaluations
Low data confidence score due to limited public documentation

dimension_explanations.alignment: ISNS shows high alignment for Muslim donors as a zakat-eligible institution providing essential religious services such as funeral rites and marriages [1][3]. The organization maintains a high donor fit despite the low data confidence score [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on capacity building through its Little Scholar Early Childhood Program and religious services [1]. While it demonstrates strong financial health with 117.3 months of working capital, the lack of third-party impact metrics results in a medium impact score [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Islamic Society of Northwest Suburbs of Chicago provides comprehensive religious services and early childhood education to the regional Muslim community.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 92.5% ensures the vast majority of funds directly support community services
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.01 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity position with 117.3 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: The Islamic Society of Northwest Suburbs of Chicago (ISNS) is a religious non-profit dedicated to the teaching of the Holy Quran, daily congregations, and Islamic education for children [1]. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported a total revenue of $4,092,615 while maintaining a high program expense ratio of 92.5% [2].

zakat services for the poor and needy
no public tracking of beneficiary counts
track and report the number of students and congregants served
all_citations.quote: Improvement: Track and report beneficiary counts

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and strong alignment with donor needs, though it is limited by low data transparency and a lack of independent impact verification.

areas_for_improvement.context: There is currently <cite id="17">no public tracking of beneficiary counts</cite> or external impact evaluations.
The organization has <cite id="18">low data confidence (0.3)</cite> due to a lack of published theory of change or audited financials.

bbb_assessment.summary: This organization has not yet been reviewed against BBB Wise Giving Alliance standards.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's 50-year track record and high asset base mitigate some concerns regarding operational stability.
risk_factors: <cite id="17">No data on number of beneficiaries served</cite>
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="18">lack of transparent impact reporting</cite> and formal outcome measurement.

confidence.notes: Financial efficiency is high, but transparency on impact is very limited.

alignment.explanation: Strong alignment for Muslim donors due to <cite id="12">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and a focus on <cite id="3">Islamic education</cite>.

credibility.explanation: While ISNS is an established institution with <cite id="11">92.5% board independence</cite>, its credibility is limited by <cite id="18">low data transparency</cite> and a lack of third-party audits.
credibility.improvement: The charity could improve by <cite id="19">publishing audited financial statements</cite> and documenting a formal theory of change.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by <cite id="8">92.5% program expense</cite>, though the lack of <cite id="17">beneficiary data</cite> makes it difficult to assess cost-effectiveness.
impact.improvement: To improve, the organization should <cite id="20">track and report the number of students and congregants served</cite> annually.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Self-reported financial data only

rich_narrative.headline: The Islamic Society of Northwest Suburbs of Chicago provides comprehensive religious services and early childhood education to the regional Muslim community.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value long-term community institutional stability and want their zakat to support local religious infrastructure with zero overhead.
donor_motivations: Want to support local Islamic education and prayer spaces
Value organizations with a multi-decade track record
Seek to fulfill zakat through a trusted local masjid
giving_considerations: Donations support a large endowment/asset base rather than immediate relief
Limited reporting on specific social outcomes or beneficiary metrics
Focus is primarily on the Northwest Chicago suburban community
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking high-transparency international relief or those who require rigorous third-party impact evaluations.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects high financial efficiency but a total lack of <cite id="17">external outcome tracking</cite>.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: ISNS creates impact by providing the physical and educational infrastructure necessary for the practice and transmission of Islamic faith.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that educational programs are effectively meeting the needs of the youth community.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While assets are high, the <cite id="7">39.9% growth rate</cite> suggests expanding community needs.

peer_comparison.differentiator: ISNS maintains a <cite id="8">100.0% program ratio</cite>, significantly higher than the <cite id="21">peer median of 80.0%</cite>.

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="8">92.5% program expense ratio</cite> and a fundraising cost of just <cite id="10">$0.01 per $1 raised</cite>.
Operating since <cite id="1">1974</cite>, ISNS has over five decades of experience in <cite id="5">religious and social service delivery</cite>.
The charity holds <cite id="13">$10,918,031 in net assets</cite>, providing a massive <cite id="14">working capital ratio</cite> for long-term stability.

strengths_deep_dive: ISNS exhibits a unique financial profile characterized by extremely low overhead and high asset accumulation. In 2023, the organization managed <cite id="15">$10,997,666 in total assets</cite> against only <cite id="16">$79,635 in total liabilities</cite>. This fiscal conservatism is paired with aggressive growth, as seen in the <cite id="7">39.9% revenue CAGR</cite>. Their ability to scale while maintaining <cite id="8">92.5% program expense</cite> suggests a volunteer-heavy or highly subsidized operational model that maximizes the impact of every dollar donated for <cite id="12">zakat and community services</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Islamic Society of Northwest Suburbs of Chicago (ISNS) is a long-standing religious institution that has served the regional Muslim community since its <cite id="1">founding in 1974</cite>. The organization operates as a multi-functional community hub, providing <cite id="2">daily and Friday congregations</cite>, specialized <cite id="3">Islamic education for children</cite>, and early childhood development through its <cite id="4">Little Scholar program</cite>. Beyond religious services, ISNS facilitates essential community rites including <cite id="5">marriages and funeral services</cite>. Financially, the organization demonstrated significant growth in the 2023 fiscal year, reporting <cite id="6">total revenue of $4,092,615</cite>, which represents a <cite id="7">3-year revenue CAGR of 39.9%</cite>. This growth is supported by a highly efficient operational model where <cite id="8">92.5% of expenses are categorized as program-related</cite>, ensuring that donor contributions are directed almost entirely toward community services and infrastructure. The organization maintains <cite id="9">exceptional fundraising efficiency</cite>, spending only <cite id="10">$0.01 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions. With <cite id="11">92.5% independent board members</cite> and a focus on <cite id="12">zakat services for the poor and needy</cite>, ISNS functions as both a spiritual center and a social safety net for the Northwest Suburbs of Chicago.
